summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York regarding the return of a discovery drive by Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys following his death. The drive was left in a doorway for inclusion in a paralegal file.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, handling the return of discovery materials from Epstein's attorneys.

events.title: Return of Epstein Discovery Drive
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney receives and forwards a discovery drive that was returned by Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys following his death, in accordance with a protective order.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Epstein's attorneys returned a discovery drive to the U.S. Attorney's Office following his death, consistent with a protective order.
The return of materials occurred in August 2020, nearly a year after Epstein's death in August 2019.
The communication shows ongoing legal administrative activity in the Epstein case posthumously.
The materials were handled via physical drop-off (an envelope left in a doorway) rather than electronic transfer.
The correspondence is from a federal prosecutor in the Southern District of New York.
